back.text:
Root: ر أ ي (R-ʾ-Y)
Meaning: Have you seen?
Pronunciation: Araʾayta
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on رَأَ (2 counts).
Derived Words:
1. رُؤْيَة (Ruʾyah): Vision
2. رَأَى (Raʾā): He saw
3. رَاءٍ (Rāʾin): A seer
Example Ayah: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَابِ الْفِيلِ

hint.text: The opening word, a rhetorical question.

back.text:
Root: ك ذ ب (K-Dh-B)
Meaning: He denies / he tells a lie
Pronunciation: Yukadhdhibu
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on ذِّ.
Derived Words:
1. كَذِب (Kadhib): A lie
2. كَذَّاب (Kadhdhāb): A liar
3. تَكْذِيب (Takdhīb): Denial
Example Ayah: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِالدِّينِ

hint.text: Refers to the person who denies the religion.

back.text:
Root: د ع ع (D-ʿ-ʿ)
Meaning: He drives away, repels
Pronunciation: Yaduʿʿu
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on عُّ.
Derived Words:
1. دَعّ (Daʿʿ): Driving away
Example Ayah: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا

hint.text: Describes how a specific type of person treats the vulnerable.

back.text:
Root: ي ت م (Y-T-M)
Meaning: The orphan
Pronunciation: Al-Yatīm
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah; Madd Ṭabīʿī on تِي.
Derived Words:
1. يَتِيمَة (Yatīmah): A female orphan
2. أَيْتَام (Aytām): Orphans
Example Ayah: فَأَمَّا الْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ

hint.text: A vulnerable person without a parent.

back.text:
Root: ح ض ض (Ḥ-Ḍ-Ḍ)
Meaning: He urges, encourages
Pronunciation: Yaḥuḍḍu
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on ضُّ and Tafkhīm on ض.
Derived Words:
1. حَضّ (Ḥaḍḍ): An urging
2. تَحَاضّ (Taḥāḍḍ): Urging one another
Example Ayah: Unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: A reference to encouraging the feeding of the poor.

back.text:
Root: ط ع م (Ṭ-ʿ-M)
Meaning: The food
Pronunciation: Ṭaʿāmi
Tajweed Rules: Tafkhīm on Ṭ; Madd Ṭabīʿī on عَام.
Derived Words:
1. أَطْعَمَ (Aṭʿama): He fed
2. إِطْعَام (Iṭʿām): Feeding
3. مَطْعَم (Maṭʿam): A place to eat
Example Ayah: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ

hint.text: What is to be given to the needy.

back.text:
Root: س ك ن (S-K-N)
Meaning: The poor person
Pronunciation: Al-Miskīn
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah; Madd Ṭabīʿī on كِي.
Derived Words:
1. سَكَن (Sakan): A dwelling
2. سَكِينَة (Sakīnah): Tranquility
Example Ayah: وَلَا تَحُضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ

Root: و ي ل (W-Y-L)
Meaning: So woe, destruction
Pronunciation: Fawaylun
Tajweed Rules: Layyin on وَ; tanwīn pronounced clearly (iẓhār).
Derived Words:
1. وَيْل (Wayl): Woe
Example Ayah: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ يَكْتُبُونَ الْكِتَابَ بِأَيْدِيهِمْ

Root: ص ل ي (Ṣ-L-Y)
Meaning: To the praying ones
Pronunciation: Lil-Muṣallīn
Tajweed Rules: Istiʿlā on Ṣ; Shaddah on لّ; Madd Ṭabīʿī on لِّي and Madd ʿĀriḍ li-s-sukūn when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. صَلَاة (Ṣalāh): Prayer
2. صَلَّى (Ṣallā): He prayed
Example Ayah: الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ

hint.text: A reference to those who perform ṣalāh.

back.text:
Root: ر أ ي (R-ʾ-Y)
Meaning: They show off
Pronunciation: Yurāʾūna
Tajweed Rules: Madd Ṭabīʿī on رَا and on ؤُو.
Derived Words:
1. رِيَاء (Riyāʾ): Showing off
2. رَاءَى (Rāʾā): He showed off
Example Ayah: Unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: A description of a person's bad intention.

back.text:
Root: م ع ن (M-ʿ-N)
Meaning: Small kindnesses, basic necessities
Pronunciation: Al-Māʿūn
Tajweed Rules: Alif-Lām Qamariyyah; Madd Ṭabīʿī on مَا.
Derived Words:
1. مَعُونَة (Maʿūnah): Help
Example Ayah: Unique to this Sūrah in the Qurʾān.

hint.text: The title of the Sūrah, referring to everyday acts of kindness.
